intro: Samyda polyandra, commonly known as the velvetleaf or Indian nettle, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and showy, clustered flowers. The plant has a fibrous root system and can grow as an annual or perennial depending on the climate. Its leaves are often covered in fine hairs, giving them a velvety texture. Samyda polyandra is also noted for its adaptability to various soil types and its ability to thrive in disturbed habitats.
